_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

The Chittim Sales Gas Compressor Station is a newly constructed facility in an area that has a long-standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. 



Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

Chittim Sales Gas Compressor Station Description of Facility and Regulated Substances Handled:

The Chittim Sales Gas Compressor Station is a natural gas compressor station located near Eagle Pass, TX. The plant is designed to remove any liquids from the incoming natural gas stream, store NGLs on location in pressurized storage tank, to be transported by truck. The gas exits the facility to a metering skid for sales.



General Accidental Release Prevention and Chemical-specific steps:

This facility was built in accordance with the appropriate mechanical and electrical codes for gas processing plants. Written programs and procedures cover all critical equipment and the employees are well trained in the safe operation of this facility.



Five Year Accident History:

The facility has had no accidental releases that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site and no offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.



Emergency Response Program:

The Permian Area Emergency Response Plan has been coordinated with the Maverick County Emergency Management Coordinators. The Emergency Response Plan has been posted at the plant and all employees have been trained in the actions to be taken in the event of an emergency.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
